Quality Engineer responsible for composite projects & component delivery at the Sheffield facility

Creation and maintenance of quality systems and documentation to support new and on-going activities

Creation and leadership of validation frameworks & activities for new products and processes with cross-functional teams
§

Support all aspects of Quality for the assigned areas of responsibility

§
Support the containment of Quality Concern Reports (QCR) within 24 hours
§
Support the resolution of Quality concerns using a structured approach to problem solving (PPS , 8D or similar)
§
Build effective cross functional relationships and contribute to achieving a high-performance team environment

Strong knowledge & demonstrable experience with Quality Engineering skills, including PFMEA, SPC, MSA, Root Cause Analysis and auditing to established quality standards

Experience of composite production is highly desirable

Experience in automotive manufacturing is advantageous

Knowledge of Automotive quality systems is advantageous

Experience of niche vehicle (low volume) programmes desirable
§
Experience of manufacturing using fabrics desirable

Excellent communication and I.T. skills including Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint & Word)

Experience of Minitab software is desirable
§
Experience of Polyworks, Dataloop, Modus, Trios and SAP desirable but not required
Personal Attributes:
§
Passionate, enthusiastic and committed, with a can-do attitude
§
Effective communication and inter-personal skills
§
Self-driven individual, who can work autonomously and as part of a team
§
Self-directed/manged and motivated towards achieving goals
§
Excellent planning and organisations skills
§
Ability to build effective relationships and network locally, within the business
§

§
Ability to effectively influence, negotiate and use conflict resolution skills

Right to work in the UK

Flexible approach to working

What to Expect
As a Senior Tooling Engineer, you will lead a newly created composites tooling department within a fast-paced automotive manufacturing environment. You will be responsible not only for guiding a team of tooling engineers and technicians, but also for establishing the processes, standards, and workflows that will integrate this new function into the existing business. You will act as the technical authority for composite tooling, ensuring high levels of quality, manufacturability, and operational efficiency. Expect to collaborate closely with design, production, quality, and programme teams to deliver innovative tooling solutions that support advanced composite components and high-volume automotive production.
What You'll Do
Build and lead a new composite tooling department, defining its structure, processes, and best practices.
Develop and implement tooling workflows, documentation standards, and procedures to integrate the department seamlessly into the wider business.
Lead and mentor a team in the design and manufacture of composite tooling, fixtures, jigs, and associated equipment.
Oversee the full tooling lifecycle—from concept development and detailed design to validation, commissioning, and continuous improvement.
Produce and review tooling design deliverables including 3D models, drawings, BOMs, and technical specifications.
Provide expert Design for Manufacture (DFM) feedback to ensure composite component designs support efficient and repeatable production.
Define tooling materials, processes, and construction methods suitable for composite manufacturing technologies (e.g., autoclave, resin infusion, press moulding).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve manufacturability issues and optimise tooling performance.
Lead tooling trials, inspections, and root-cause analyses, implementing corrective actions as required.
Ensure compliance with internal standards, safety regulations, and industry best practices.
Manage tooling budgets, schedules, and supplier relationships.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives focused on tooling reliability, efficiency, cycle time, ergonomics, and accuracy.
What You'll Bring
Extensive experience in composite tooling engineering within automotive, motorsport, aerospace, or a similar high-performance environment.
Proven leadership experience, ideally including setting up or scaling a new department, team, or function.
Strong understanding of composite materials, lay-up techniques, curing processes, and manufacturing technologies.
High proficiency with CAD tools (e.g., CATIA, Siemens NX, SolidWorks) and familiarity with PLM/PDM systems.
Demonstrated ability to provide DFM guidance and develop robust, production-ready tooling solutions.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, including experience with root-cause analysis and continuous improvement.
Excellent communication, influencing, and stakeholder management skills, especially when integrating new processes across an established organisation.
Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently in a fast-moving manufacturing environment.
A proactive mindset with a commitment to safety, quality, and operational excellence.

What to Expect
As a Composites Tooling Designer, you will play a key role in developing high-quality tooling for composite components used in an advanced automotive production environment. You will work closely with engineering, manufacturing, and quality teams to create robust tooling solutions that support efficient, repeatable, and high-volume composite manufacturing. You can expect to work in a fast-paced environment where precision, attention to detail, and strong problem-solving skills are essential. This is a hands-on design role with opportunities to influence part manufacturability and drive improvements in tooling performance and production processes.
What You'll Do
Design composite tooling, fixtures, jigs, moulds, and assembly aids to support production of composite components.
Create detailed 3D CAD models, 2D drawings, and supporting documentation following internal standards and manufacturing best practices.
Work with engineering teams to review product designs and provide Design for Manufacture (DFM) feedback to ensure efficient tooling and production processes.
Support prototype and production tooling development from concept through to release.
Collaborate with manufacturing, production engineering, and tooling technicians to refine tooling designs and address build or process challenges.
Assist in tooling trials, fit checks, and validation activities, making design adjustments as needed.
Select appropriate materials and construction methods for moulds, patterns, and fixtures based on component requirements, durability, and production volumes.
Manage design changes, revisions, and configuration control through PLM/PDM systems.
Ensure that tooling designs comply with safety, ergonomic, and quality standards.
Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives focused on tooling reliability, accuracy, and cycle-time reduction.
What You'll Bring
Experience in composite tooling design within automotive, motorsport, aerospace, or a similar manufacturing industry.
Strong proficiency in CAD software (e.g., CATIA, Siemens NX, SolidWorks) with the ability to produce detailed and accurate models and drawings.
Understanding of composite materials, lay-up methods, curing processes, and relevant manufacturing technologies.
Knowledge of tooling materials, construction techniques, and manufacturing processes such as machining, pattern making, and mould fabrication.
Ability to interpret engineering drawings, GD&T, and technical specifications.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to provide practical, production-focused design solutions.
Effective communication and collaboration skills when working with cross-functional teams.
High attention to detail, strong organisational skills, and the ability to manage multiple design tasks simultaneously.
A proactive, solution-driven mindset with a commitment to quality and continuous improvement.
